alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:43AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, southwestern Clarendon, south central Sumter and southeastern Orangeburg Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 543 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elloree to near Bowman to near Reevesville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45-50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Holly Hill, Summerton, Elloree, Santee State Park, Santee, Eutawville, Paxville, Vance, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, St. Paul, Stumphole Landing, Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Mill Creek Marina and Campground, Low Falls Landing and Lone Star. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 160 and 169. Interstate 95 between mile markers 85 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
